oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of the Old Hickory Village Firehall
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Firehall at the Old Hickory DuPont Gunpowder plant. Pictured are three vehicles, which are manned by seven individuals. To the left of the fire department is a small wooden time keeping hut. The firehall was operated by a full-time staff working around the clock shifts. The building contained three bays: one for a pumper-hose truck, one for a ladder and auxiliary truck, and one for the Fire Chief's vehicle. There was also an office and hose tower where the cotton hoses were hung to dry after use.
